```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(plotly)
library(flexdashboard)
```

```{r import, include=FALSE}
data(ny_noaa)

ny_noaa=ny_noaa
```

I will first tidy the data set. It is important to standardize some of the values including, `snow`, `tmax`, `tmin`, and `prcp`. I am using `filter` to make my dataset smaller, so that the data can be more easily processed by my computer without crashing.

```{r tidy, include=FALSE}
ny_noaa <- ny_noaa %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>%
  separate(date, into=c("year", "month", "day"), sep= "-") %>%
  mutate(tmax = as.numeric(tmax)/10,
         tmin = as.numeric(tmin)/10,
        prcp = as.numeric(prcp)/10,
        snow_mm=snow, 
        snow=round(snow_mm*0.03937*4)/4) %>% 
  drop_na() %>% 
  filter(year>2000 & year<2008) %>% 
  select(-snow)
```

Column {data-width=650}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Chart A

```{r}
ny_noaa %>% 
  plot_ly(x=~year, y = ~snow_mm, color = ~year, type = "box", colors = "viridis")
```

Column {data-width=350}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Chart B

```{r}
ny_noaa %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~year, y = ~snow_mm, color = ~year, type = "bar", colors = "viridis")
```

### Chart C

```{r}
ny_noaa %>%
  plot_ly(
    x = ~year, y = ~tmin, type = "scatter", mode = "markers", alpha = 0.5)
```
